ARABIC: مَآ أَغْنَىٰ عَنْهُم مَّا كَانُوا۟ يُمَتَّعُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: that what they enjoyed will be of any use to them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Of what avail shall their enjoyment be to them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: of what avail will be the provisions of life which they have been granted to enjoy?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: none of their luxuries will be able to save them from the torment?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So of what benefit will be the comforts that they were using?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That which they were made to enjoy shall not avail them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: what will it then avail them, the enjoyment of days they were given?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (How) that wherewith they were contented naught availeth them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: of what avail would their past enjoyment be to them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: What shall that which they enjoyed avail them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: of what avail to them will be that which they were given to enjoy?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: It will profit them not that they enjoyed (this life)!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: All that with which they used to enjoy shall not avail them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: what avail will their past enjoyments be to them?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Of what avail to them will be their past enjoyments?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: They would not be availed by the enjoyment with which they were provided.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [26:207] in what way (mā here is interrogative) would that enjoyment which they were given avail them?, in averting the chastisement or mitigating it? It would be of no avail!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((How) that wherewith) Allah's punishment (they were contented) because of the reprieve (naught availeth them) from Allah's punishment? 423
